top_categories.workout_context: At 100 miles, Almanzo 100 punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
Racing Almanzo 100 isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Almanzo 100’s mixed gravel — well-maintained early, freshly laid loose stone mid-race demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Almanzo 100 rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Almanzo 100 when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Almanzo 100. Make this intensity feel like home.
Every session at Almanzo 100 intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Almanzo 100’s mixed gravel — well-maintained early, freshly laid loose stone mid-race and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
At 100 miles, Almanzo 100 rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Almanzo 100 — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Almanzo 100’s mixed gravel — well-maintained early, freshly laid loose stone mid-race delivers on race day.
Almanzo 100’s 6,500ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.

race_overlay.heat: May in Spring Valley, Minnesota can bring heat. Complete 3–4 heat exposure sessions in the final 2 weeks before Almanzo 100. Increase sodium intake 48 hours before race day.
race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Almanzo 100’s 100 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Almanzo 100 requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on mixed gravel — well-maintained early, freshly laid loose stone mid-race to build confidence.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Race Simulation, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 100 miles of mixed gravel — well-maintained early, freshly laid loose stone mid-race in Spring Valley, Minnesota.
